definition: endgame/conclusion/outcome/final part of a chess game
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: The award made by the Tribunal shall be final and binding upon both parities.
sentences.chinese: 该仲裁庭的裁决是终局的，对双方均具有约束力。

sentences.english: The arbitral award shall be final and binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁裁决是终局的，对双方都有约束力。

sentences.english: It is quite usual that a soccer game ends in a scoreless tie.
sentences.chinese: 足球比赛以零比零终局是常事。

sentences.english: Such decision shall be final and binding on the Parties.
sentences.chinese: 该裁判属终局裁判，对缔约双方均有拘束力。

sentences.english: China's sports arbitrating should choose compulsory mechanism of "first award being the final award".
sentences.chinese: 我国体育仲裁应选择强制性“一裁终局”制。

sentences.english: The award given by the Arbitration Commission shall be final and binding upon both parties.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁委员会的裁决为终局性的，对双方生效。

sentences.english: The award rendered through the arbitration shall be final and binding on the parties in any event.
sentences.chinese: 仲裁裁决是终局的，对双方均有拘束力。

sentences.english: "This battle has reached its bitter end, " he said.
sentences.chinese: 他说“战斗已到痛苦的终局”。

sentences.english: The decisions of the judging panel are final and no correspondence will be entered into.
sentences.chinese: 该决定的，评审团是终局的，没有函授，将进入。

definition: end of the road/final road/fig. dead end/impasse
victory or defeat/the outcome of a battle
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
Crime and Punishment by Dostoyevsky 陀思妥耶夫斯基[Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1]
